entry.title: Hundred Days Of Code - 1st Week
entry.content:
My Motivation:

After quitting my job from Application (R&D) Scientist at Bay instrument, I kinda slow down my career development and become a stay-at-home mom. I do really enjoy the time with my baby boy, but the feeling of depression and anxiety comes and goes. Being a full-time mom is lack of appreciation or a missing sense of accomplishment compared to what I did before as PhD and/or Scientist. So, I want to change the daily schedule for myself, for a better future, after my boy go to preK. Here I commit myself to take 100 Days of Code Challenge where I spend at least one hour coding for 100 days (in a row).

Jane Goodall once said:

What you do makes a difference, and you have to decide what kind of difference you want to make.

My big motivation for taking this challenge is Learn to Code to make a difference in changing people’s life.


This Is My Main Goals:

    1. Complete the FreeCampCode Web Certificate
    2. Have a capability to customize the design of a blog

This is the log for the first week:

    Day1:
      1. Learn Basic HTML & HTML5
      2. Create my Github page
    Day2:
      1. Continue to Learn HTML & HTML5
      2. Setup local work environment with Atom, GitKraken
    Day3:
      1. Learn CSS Style
      2. Learn Jekyll blogging
    Day4:
      1. Done 35% of Applied Visual Design
      2. Get familiar with Jekyll blog
    Day5:
      1. Learn Applied Visual Design
      2. Learn Jekyll Theme
    Day6:
      1. Completed Applied Visual Design
      2. Jekyll Theme with @mmistakes
      3. Learn git and work jekyll blog in the local
    Day7:
      1. Completed Design Principles & CSS Flexbox
      2. Quarterly done with CSS Grid

Resources: Her story of completing 100DaysOfCode FreeCodeCamp Podcast of #100DaysOfCode
